intro: Stachys sieboldii var. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate betony, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features square, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces spikes of purple or pink flowers in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
